title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Depression: A Systematic Review
abstract: This systematic review examines the effectiveness of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) in treating depression. We analyzed 45 randomized controlled trials involving 3,200 participants. Results show that CBT is significantly more effective than control conditions for reducing depressive symptoms.
authors: Smith, J.A.; Johnson, M.K.; Brown, S.L.

title: Machine Learning Applications in Mental Health Screening
abstract: Recent advances in machine learning have opened new possibilities for mental health screening and diagnosis. This paper reviews current applications of ML techniques including natural language processing and deep learning for analyzing patient data and predicting mental health outcomes.
authors: Davis, R.M.; Wilson, K.J.; Thompson, L.P.

title: Effectiveness of Online CBT Interventions: A Meta-Analysis
abstract: The COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated the adoption of online therapy interventions. This meta-analysis evaluates the effectiveness of internet-delivered cognitive behavioral therapy compared to face-to-face therapy across 25 studies.
authors: Garcia, M.A.; Lee, S.H.; Anderson, D.R.

title: Depression Treatment Outcomes in Primary Care Settings
abstract: This longitudinal study follows 500 patients receiving depression treatment in primary care settings over 12 months. We examine treatment adherence, symptom improvement, and factors associated with positive outcomes.
authors: Miller, P.K.; Jones, A.B.; White, C.D.

title: Thérapie cognitivo-comportementale pour la dépression chez les adolescents
abstract: Cette étude examine l'efficacité de la thérapie cognitivo-comportementale (TCC) pour traiter la dépression chez les adolescents. Les résultats montrent une amélioration significative des symptômes dépressifs après 12 semaines de traitement.
authors: Dubois, L.; Martin, F.; Rousseau, A.

title: Neuroscience Basis of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy
abstract: Understanding the neural mechanisms underlying CBT can help optimize treatment protocols. This review synthesizes neuroimaging studies investigating brain changes associated with successful CBT treatment for depression and anxiety disorders.
authors: Neural, B.R.; Cortex, F.L.; Synapse, N.T.

title: Digital Health Interventions for Mental Health: A Scoping Review
abstract: Digital health technologies are increasingly used in mental health care. This scoping review maps the landscape of digital interventions including mobile apps, virtual reality, and AI-powered tools for mental health support.
authors: Tech, D.I.; App, M.H.; Virtual, R.E.

title: Economic Evaluation of CBT vs Medication for Depression
abstract: This health economics study compares the cost-effectiveness of cognitive behavioral therapy versus antidepressant medication for treating depression in healthcare systems. Analysis includes direct costs, quality-adjusted life years, and long-term outcomes.
authors: Economy, H.E.; Budget, C.A.; Value, Q.L.
